ratings.comment: Dr. Lee was great. Phys 335 is very hard but she is very caring and good at explaining. Dr. Lee does make the exam material (quizzes and exams) very hard/specific though.

They have recently changed the Phys lab set-up so Grace teaches the lab portion and there are no more lab exams and I think it works really well. There are 8 lab questions on each exam which are somewhat hard but focus on the main parts of lab. Not hard to get a good grade if you study the lab packets! (Beware: pre-lab quizzes get a lot harder!!)

Grace is the lab director for physiology 335, and she is extremely passionate and energetic. Definitely prepare for the pre-lab quizzes because the questions can be tricky. Also take advantage of the TA's and Grace herself by asking lots of questions to make sure you understand the lab and get all the right answers so you are prepared for the exam.

The way the lab was set up was just bizarre to me. Since Grace is not actually present during the lab it seemed like what she thought we were learning was different than what we really were. I could never predict the questions and a lot of them were over problems we had literally never done in class. Always did worse on lab exams than lecture.

The lab portion of this class is HARD. I personally found the lab exams harder than the actual lecture exams because it seemed a lot less clear what would be on them. However, Grace is very willing to help you out if you don't quite understand something. She does a much better job of explaining things than the TA's who run the lab.

Grace taught the lab portion of 335 and boy was it tough. The lab exams are almost more difficult than the actual class exams. Grace is awesome, but the lab is lead by students. When you actually interact with Grace she's hilarious. Definitely recommend attending her office hours. She explains things well and genuinely cares.
Grace makes lab incredibly entertaining and definitely knows what she is talking about. Post-lab quizzes are difficult! Be sure to study and read the materials outside of lab!

Love, love, love Grace!! Makes lab really fun and interesting, and is always upbeat and energetic. ALWAYS willing to help if you don't quite understand something, and doesn't make you feel stupid for not understanding. The only downside were the post lab quizzes, which are pretty difficult. Didn't always seem to focus on what was emphasized in lab
